meanings.definition: To set or establish limits or boundaries before something else happens.
meanings.sent1: She prelimits her spending each month to avoid going over budget.
meanings.sent2: The teacher prelimits the number of students allowed in the classroom for safety reasons.
meanings.sent3: The cat prelimits its territory by marking it with scent.
meanings.sent4: The fence prelimits the garden, keeping out unwanted visitors.
meanings.sent5: He prelimits his study time to ensure he has time for other activities.

meanings.definition: To restrict or confine within certain limits or boundaries.
meanings.sent1: The company prelimits the amount of overtime employees can work to prevent burnout.
meanings.sent2: The rules prelimit the number of guests allowed at the party.
meanings.sent3: The jar prelimits the amount of cookies you can take.
meanings.sent4: The dam prelimits the flow of water downstream.
meanings.sent5: The doctor prelimits the patient's sugar intake to manage their diabetes.
